trans-unit.source: Represents an <xref uid="langword_csharp_<X509Data>" name="<X509Data>" href=""></xref> subelement of an XMLDSIG or XML Encryption <xref uid="langword_csharp_<KeyInfo>" name="<KeyInfo>" href=""></xref> element.
The KeyInfoX509Data class represents the `<X509Data>` element that contains X.509v3 certificate information related to the validation or encryption key.

For example, an `<X509Data>` element might contain an X.509 certificate whose subject public key is the validation key, or a chain of X.509 certificates that terminate in a certificate for the validating key, or other identifiers for related X.509 certificates.
Use the KeyInfoX509Data class whenever you need to include X.509 certificate data in an encrypted or signed XML document.

For more information about the `<X509Data>` element, see Section 4.4.4 of the XMLDSIG specification, which is available from the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/, or see the XML Encryption specification, which is available from the W3C at www.w3.org/TR/xmlenc-core/.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> class from the specified ASN.1 DER encoding of an X.509v3 certificate.

The ASN.1 DER encoding of an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate"></xref> object to initialize the new instance of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> from.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> class from the specified X.509v3 certificate.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate"></xref> object to initialize the new instance of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> from.
The cert parameter is .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> class from the specified X.509v3 certificate.

The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate"></xref> object to initialize the new instance of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> from.
One of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509IncludeOption"></xref> values that specifies how much of the certificate chain to include.
The cert parameter is .
The certificate has only a partial certificate chain.
Adds the specified X.509v3 certificate to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate"></xref> object to add to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
The certificate parameter is .
Adds the specified issuer name and serial number pair to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
For identification, each X.509v3 certificate carries the name of the certification authority that issued the certificate paired with a unique serial number assigned by the certification authority.

The AddIssuerSerial method adds information about an issuer name and serial number pair to a list of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.X509IssuerSerial> objects that are accessible through the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data.IssuerSerials%2A> property.
The issuer name portion of the pair to add to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
The serial number portion of the pair to add to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
Adds the specified subject key identifier (SKI) byte array to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
Subject key identifiers (SKIs) are a way of identifying certificates that contain a certain public key.
A byte array that represents the subject key identifier (SKI) to add to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
Adds the specified subject key identifier (SKI) string to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
Subject key identifiers (SKIs) are a shorthand way to identify certificates that contain a certain public key.
A string that represents the subject key identifier (SKI) to add to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
Adds the subject name of the entity that was issued an X.509v3 certificate to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
The name of the entity that was issued an X.509 certificate to add to the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
Gets a list of the X.509v3 certificates contained in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
A list of the X.509 certificates contained in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the Certificate Revocation List (CRL) contained within the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
The Certificate Revocation List (CRL) contained within the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
Returns an XML representation of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlElement> object returned by this method is suitable for use as a subelement of an XMLDSIG or XML encryption `<KeyInfo>` element.
An XML representation of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
Gets a list of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.X509IssuerSerial"></xref> structures that represent an issuer name and serial number pair.

The IssuerSerials property represents the `<X509IssuerSerial`> element of an XML digital signature using a list of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.X509IssuerSerial> structures contained within.
The `<X509IssuerSerial`> element represents an issuer name and serial number pair, which identify a specific X.509v3 certificate.
The issuer of an X.509 certificate is the name of the certification authority that issued the certificate.
Certification authorities assign each certificate they issue a unique serial number.
You can add a name and serial number pair using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data.AddIssuerSerial%2A> method.
A list of <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.X509IssuerSerial"></xref> structures that represent an issuer name and serial number pair.
Parses the input <xref href="System.Xml.XmlElement"></xref> object and configures the internal state of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object to match.
This method is typically used to process an `<X509Data>` subelement of a `<KeyInfo>` element.
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlElement"></xref> object that specifies the state of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
The element parameter is .
The element parameter does not contain an <> node.
-or- The element parameter does not contain an <> node.
Gets a list of the subject key identifiers (SKIs) contained in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
Subject key identifiers (SKIs) are a way to identify certificates that contain a certain public key.
An SKI can be used to identify one or more certificates issued to a particular subject key pair.
A list of the subject key identifiers (SKIs) contained in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
Gets a list of the subject names of the entities contained in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
Every X.509v3 certificate includes a subject name.
This name can be used to identify one or more certificates.
A list of the subject names of the entities contained in the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data"></xref> object.
